newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on hedges, CBOT soy pressure.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on hedges, CBOT soy pressure.

text.p: WCE canola ended down on hedge and CBOT soycomplex pressure, traders said.

"There were 800 hedges, 1,000 Mar-May spread, Cargill bought 500 May-July and crushers bought 400 May," a trader said. March canola futures crush margin rose to -21.01 from -22.45 Tuesday based on CBOT soyoil and meal. March-May spread at $0.50, May-July $0.50. Volume was 9,550 lots, or 191,000 tonnes, with 800 hedges.
March canola lost $4.50 to finish at $408.60 and May ended down $3.60 at $408.30. November flax lost $2.80 to $318 as RBC-DS sold to commercials, traders said. Oats did not trade.

February western barley was unchanged at $137.50 on the last trading day, May rose $0.60 to $136.60 with Midland Walwyn selling, Alberta Wheat Pool buying. July-Oct spread at $1.50, Feb-Mar $1. Volume was 1,525 lots, or 30,500 tonnes.

"It's the last day in the Feb, there's hardly been any deliveries all month. Where's the short?" one trader said. March feed wheat lost $0.60 to $165.50 on commercials after market on open hedges at $166, Mar-May was bid at $2.
RBC-DS and commercials bought Feb, May and October feed peas unchanged, up US$2.20 and US$2.50 respectively from PCTS and LFG, traders said. Volume was 25 lots.
(Values in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats and peas.)
